title: Agnatha
summary: Agnatha (/ˈæɡnəθə, æɡˈneɪθə/, Ancient Greek[4] ἀ-γνάθος 'without jaws') is an infraphylum[5] of jawless fish in the phylum Chordata, subphylum Vertebrata, consisting of both present (cyclostomes) and extinct (conodonts and ostracoderms) species. Among recent animals, cyclostomes are sister to all vertebrates with jaws, known as gnathostomes.[6]
